citeinfo.title: Shoreline_Forecast_template - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 5.0.20180213.1225 Shoreline Forecast Feature Class

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS version 5.0 software applications and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 5.0): U.S. Geological Survey software

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.othercit: Suggested citation: Himmelstoss, E.A., Farris, A.S., Henderson, R.E., Kratzmann, M.G., Ergul, A., Zhang, O., Zichichi, J.L., and Thieler, E.R., 2018, Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 5.0): U.S. Geological Survey software, https://doi.org/10.5066/P9VW42I0 .

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (DSAS) Version 5.0 User Guide

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

citeinfo.othercit: Suggested citation: Himmelstoss, E.A., Henderson, R.E., Kratzmann, M, Farris, A., 2018, DSAS version 5.0 user guide. U.S. Geological Survey report 2018-1179, https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20181179

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains a polyline shoreline representing the possible location of a shoreline in the future and was generated by the beta Shoreline Forecasting tool in the DSAS version 5.0 software application.

procstep.procdesc: Transect features generated using DSAS version 5.0.20180213.1225. Parameters Used: baseline layer=_____, baseline group field=___, transect spacing=______, search distance=______, land direction=_____, shoreline intersection=____, smoothing distance=_____, For additional details on these parameters, please see the DSAS help file distributed with the DSAS software, or visit the USGS DSAS website at: https://www.usgs.gov/centers/whcmsc/science/digital-shoreline-analysis-system-dsas

Shoreline intersects and rate calculations performed. Parameters used: transect file=_____, shoreline layer=_________, shoreline date field=_____, shoreline uncertainty field name=______, the default accuracy=____, shoreline intersection=______, stats calculations=_____, shoreline threshold=____, confidence interval=______.

Shoreline forecast (polyline and point) and uncertainty calculated. A =______ (10/20) year shoreline forecast with uncertainty was performed using: input rate file (containing LRR values used in forecasting)=_________, and intersect file=_______.

enttyp.enttypd: Shoreline forecasts are generated by DSAS using the linear regression rate (LRR) value from the transect rate file with the same timestamp.

attr.attrdef: The object identification field is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It establishes a unique ID for each row in the attribute table.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The geometry field (shape) is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It provides a definition of the feature type (point, line, polygon).
The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).

edom.edomvd: The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).
The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).

attr.attrdef: The year the forecast represents (date of model run +10/20 years).

attrdomv.udom: The forecast year is the shoreline forecast horizion at either 10 or 20 years from the current date at the time the forecast is calculated.

attr.attrdef: Length of shoreline forecast polyline in meter units, assuming data was properly projected in a meter-based coordinate system. This field is automatically generated and maintained when data is within a geodatabase.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
